title: Add comprehensive admin panel for footer section management

requirements.text: Create a new FooterManager admin component that allows editing of all footer sections (Contact Information, Quick Links, Social Media) and their headings

quotes: give option to modify all sections and headings present in the footer section

acceptanceCriteria: FooterManager component displays all current footer sections with their headings
Admin can edit the heading text for each footer section
Admin can modify contact information fields (address, phone, email)
Admin can edit or add/remove quick navigation links
Changes are persisted to the backend and reflected in the Footer component

requirements.text: Implement drag-and-drop or up/down controls in FooterManager to allow reordering of footer sections

quotes: have the option to rearrange the order of sections in the footer

acceptanceCriteria: Admin can change the display order of footer sections (Contact, Quick Links, Social Media)
Reordering is intuitive using either drag-and-drop or arrow buttons
New section order is saved and persists across sessions
Footer component renders sections in the admin-specified order

requirements.text: Extend backend data model to support footer section configuration including section titles, content, and display order
acceptanceCriteria: Backend stores footer section headings as configurable text fields
Backend stores section order as a sortable array or numeric positions
Query and mutation functions exist for retrieving and updating footer section configuration
State migration handles the new footer configuration structure

requirements.text: Add FooterManager tab to the AdminPanel component alongside existing Content, Hero Theme, Clinics, Services, Reviews, and Social Media tabs
acceptanceCriteria: New 'Footer' tab appears in AdminPanel component
Tab displays the FooterManager component when selected
Tab follows the same design pattern as existing admin tabs

requirements.text: Update Footer component to render sections dynamically based on admin-configured order and headings from backend
acceptanceCriteria: Footer fetches section configuration from backend
Footer renders sections in the order specified by admin
Footer displays custom heading text for each section
Layout remains responsive and consistent with existing UI design

constraints: Maintain the current UI design and visual styling of the footer
Preserve existing footer functionality including EditableFooterContent and social media integration
Follow single-actor backend architecture in main.mo
nonGoals: Changing the overall visual design or color scheme of the footer
Adding new footer sections beyond the existing Contact, Quick Links, and Social Media
